Generation I.Red: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
Generation I.Yellow: Both its fur and its tails are beautiful. As it grows, the tails split and form more tails.
Generation I.Stadium: A single, white-colored tail splits into six beautiful tails. As it grows older, it grows even more tails.

Generation II.Gold: As it develops, its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.
Generation II.Silver: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.
Generation II.Crystal: As its body grows larger, its six warm tails become more beautiful, with a more luxurious coat of fur.
Generation II.Stadium 2: As it develops, its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: At the time of its birth, Vulpix has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this Pok é mon receives plenty of love from its Trainer . The six tails become magnificently curled.
Generation III.Sapphire: Inside Vulpix 's body burns a flame that never goes out. During the daytime, when the temperatures rise, this Pok é mon releases flames from its mouth to prevent its body from growing too hot.
Generation III.Emerald: It can freely control fire, making fiery orbs fly like will-o'-the-wisps. Just before evolution, its six tails grow hot as if on fire.
Generation III.FireRed: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
Generation III.LeafGreen: When it is born, it has just one snow-white tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

Generation IV.Diamond: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
Generation IV.Pearl: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
Generation IV.Platinum: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
Generation IV.HeartGold: As it develops, its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.

Generation V.Black: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
Generation V.White: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
Generation V.Black 2: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.
Generation V.White 2: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

Generation VI.X: When it is born, it has just one snow-white tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.
Generation VI.Y: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: At the time of its birth, Vulpix has one white tail. The tail separates into six if this Pokémon receives plenty of love from its Trainer. The six tails become magnificently curled.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Inside Vulpix's body burns a flame that never goes out. During the daytime, when the temperatures rise, this Pokémon releases flames from its mouth to prevent its body from growing too hot.

Generation VII.Sun: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit . Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.
Generation VII.Moon: In hot weather, this Pokémon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: If you carelessly approach it because it's cute, the boss of the pack, Ninetales, will appear and freeze you.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: They live together in a skulk, helping one another. Before eating their prey, they freeze it solid with their –58 degree Fahrenheit breath.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It looks like snow come to life, and the breath it exhales is −58 degrees Fahrenheit . Another name for it is Keokeo.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It looks like snow come to life, and the breath it exhales is −58 degrees Fahrenheit . Another name for it is Keokeo.

Generation VIII.Sword: After long years in the ever-snowcapped mountains of Alola, this Vulpix has gained power over ice.
Generation VIII.Shield: If you observe its curly hairs through a microscope, you'll see small ice particles springing up.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: These Pokémon live in packs in the snowy mountains and defend themselves with icy breath. I suspect this species changed its form to adapt to the frigid climate.

Generation IX.Scarlet: They live together in a skulk, helping one another. Before eating their prey, they freeze it solid with their −58 degree Fahrenheit breath.
Generation IX.Violet: In hot weather, this Pokémon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.
